identificationModule.briefTitle: Adaptive Cell Phone Support to Promote Medication Adherence
identificationModule.officialTitle: Adaptive Cell Phone Support to Promote Medication Adherence Among Adolescents and Young Adults With Chronic Health Conditions

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
The goal of this pilot clinical trial is to refine and test a mobile health intervention for promoting medication adherence in a population of adolescents and young adults with chronic health conditions. The main question\[s\] it aims to answer are:

* How should the intervention be designed to best fit patients' needs and preferences?
* Is an adaptive intervention (personalizing the intensity of support based on patients' needs) efficacious for promoting medication adherence Researchers will compare the adaptive intervention to automated text message reminders see if the adaptive intervention shows stronger positive effects on medication adherence.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: An initial cohort of adolescents with chronic health conditions will be asked to try the intervention and give feedback to refine the structure and content. Then, a larger cohort will progress through a sequential multiple assignment randomized trial to 1) be randomized to either automated text reminders (active control condition) or computer-delivered Cell Phone Support and then 2) those in the computer-delivered Cell Phone Support condition who do not show a sufficient response will be re-assigned to continued computer-delivered Cell Phone Support only or to Adaptive Cell Phone Support ( computer-delivered Cell Phone Support + responsive human coaching).

armGroups.label: Adaptive Cell Phone Support
armGroups.description: Computer-delivered cell phone support (reminders, problem-solving, referrals to resources) and responsive human coaching (phone calls, test messages, in-app messaging) to improved medication adherence.

armGroups.label: Computer-Delivered Cell Phone Support
armGroups.description: Computer-delivered cell phone support (reminders, problem-solving, referrals to resources)

armGroups.label: Automated Text Reminders
armGroups.description: Scheduled one-way text automated message reminders to take medication

interventions.name: Adaptive Cell Phone Support
interventions.description: Mobile health adherence promotion based on the supportive accountability model

interventions.name: Computer-Delivered Cell Phone Support
interventions.description: Mobile health adherence promotion based on the supportive accountability model

interventions.name: Automated Text Reminders
interventions.description: Scheduled text reminder to take medication

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean scores on the Mobile Health App Usability Questionnaire
primaryOutcomes.description: Higher scores indicate greater ease with which users can use technology to achieve a particular goal; the minimum value of this questionnaire is 1 and the maximum value is 7.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Total scores on the theoretical framework of acceptability questionnaire
primaryOutcomes.description: Higher scores indicate a greater "extent to which people delivering or receiving a healthcare intervention consider it to be appropriate, based on anticipated or experienced cognitive and emotional responses to the intervention"; the minimum value of this questionnaire is 7 and the maximum value is 35.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Total scores on the Visual Analogue Scale
primaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of doses taken our of 100%; higher numbers indicate greater medication adherence. This scale presents participants with a line, marked 0 on the left and 100 on the right, and participants can drag a marker to the place on the line that best visually indicated their adherence.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Total scores on Rollnick's Readiness Ruler
primaryOutcomes.description: Higher scores on this measure indicate more motivation to take medication as prescribed; the minimum value of this questionnaire is 0 and the maximum value is 10.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Total Transition Readiness scores on the Successful Transition to Adulthood with Therapeutic = Rx Questionnaire
primaryOutcomes.description: Higher scores on extent to which patients are prepared to manage their health condition as adults, outside of the pediatric system; ; the minimum value of this questionnaire is 0 and the maximum value is 90.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Children's Hospital Los Angeles patient
* between 15-20 years old
* taking at least one oral medication per day for a chronic health condition
* English speaking
* demonstrating sufficient cognitive capacity to engage in the assent/consent process and study procedures
* has a cell phone

There is no exclusion criteria.

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: De-identified study data and associated documentation will be made available to the research community free of charge through the data repository hosted at Open Science Framework (OSF).
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: Final submission and release of the study data will occur within 12 months of the conclusion of data collection, and within the award period. Study data deposited in OSF will be available to the research community in perpetuity.
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria: Any OSF users can access the protocol, plan, and de-identified data.
